title: As Harris Visits Detroit, Some Democrats See Ground To Be Made Up
content: Democrats have long won by wide margins in Detroit, but some party leaders said the vice president needed to do more to counter an assertive Trump campaign.

title: Trump’s Border Plans Are Light on Details but Strong on Fury
content: The former president’s sweeping immigration proposals face daunting challenges, but voters still trust his positions more than his opponent’s.

title: Harris Has Raised $1 Billion. Can She Get Donors to Give More?
content: The sheer amount of money Kamala Harris has raised in her run for president has had unintended consequences.

title: Two Opinion Columnists on Melania Trump’s Memoir
content: Pamela Paul and Carlos Lozada dig into the former first lady’s “book-adjacent object.”

title: Can the Stock Market Keep Going Up? Market Watchers Think So.
content: The bullishness on Wall Street is largely based on confidence that the Federal Reserve will tame inflation, the economy will remain solid and corporate earnings will continue to grow.

title: The Hard Truth About Montana and Jon Tester’s Senate Race
content: The state’s changing electorate and America’s polarized politics have turned Montana’s Senate race into the most consequential of the year.

title: What’s So Funny About a Dictator? Venezuela’s Comedians-in-Exile Have Ideas
content: A generation that fled political persecution and economic hardship is finding a way to laugh amid the pain.

title: Want More Inflation? Go Ahead, Let Presidents Meddle With the Fed
content: When presidents try to influence the central bank, they tend to push for lower interest rates — and that’s the problem.

title: Need Help Understanding the Election? Try These Audiobooks
content: Gripping histories, cleareyed memoirs and satirical fiction can help you make sense of our political moment.

title: Fanfare for a Common Building
content: An apartment house on the Upper West Side turns 100.

title: How a Man Imprisoned in New York Could Sway a Key House Race in Alaska
content: Eric Hafner, who is serving a 20-year sentence, is running to represent a state in which he has never set foot. He could play the spoiler under Alaska’s ranked-choice system.

title: Trump Bobs His Head to Music for 30 Minutes in Odd Town Hall Detour
content: After multiple interruptions, Donald Trump cut off questions and seemed to decide that it would be more enjoyable for all concerned — and, it appeared, for himself —  if he fired up his campaign playlist.

title: Harris Uses Trump’s Own Words to Attack Him as ‘Unhinged’: ‘Roll the Clip’
content: At a rally in Pennsylvania, in a swing county in a swing state, Vice President Kamala Harris played clips of Donald Trump describing critics as an “enemy from within,” drawing jeers from her crowd.

title: America Is on the Brink of a Great Political Realignment. It’s Already Visible in Arizona.
content: He and his acolytes purged the G.O.P. to make it smaller and more strident.

title: A Harris Ad Uses the Hurricanes to Try to Inflict Damage on Trump
content: Two former homeland security officials under Donald J. Trump describe how he tried to withhold disaster aid from states that he hadn’t won.

title: How Door Knocking Is Going in a Wisconsin Swing County
content: Door County, Wis., has picked the presidential winner since 1996. Last time, the margin was 292 votes, so the campaigns are trying to reach every household.

title: Conservative Activist Seizes on Passages From Harris Book
content: A report by Christopher Rufo says the Democratic presidential nominee copied five short passages for her 2009 book on crime. A plagiarism expert said the lapses were not serious.

title: Kamala Harris Sets an Interview With a Not-So-Friendly Outlet: Fox News
content: The interview, to be conducted by the anchor Bret Baier in Pennsylvania, will air Wednesday at 6 p.m. Eastern.

title: Doctors, A.I. and Empathy for Patients
content: Readers discuss a guest essay about ChatGPT’s bedside manner. Also: Breast cancer screenings; Walz’s missteps; supporting the mental health of schoolchildren.

title: Most Voters Have Been Offended by Trump. It’s Not Always a Deal Breaker.
content: Voters who said they had been offended by Donald J. Trump, but not recently, supported him by a wide margin.

title: Michigan Republican Blames ‘Proofing Error’ for Misleading Ad in Black-Owned Newspaper
content: The state’s legislative Black caucus has asked the attorney general and a county prosecutor to investigate Tom Barrett’s congressional campaign for potential voter disenfranchisement.

title: Harris’s Final Challenge: Restore a Splintering Democratic Coalition
content: Defections from Black and Latino voters are making Kamala Harris more dependent on white, suburban voters — and complicating her path to victory.

title: Harris Steps Up a Major Push for Black Voters
content: The vice president released a plan to help Black men financially, held interviews with two Black media outlets and put out targeted ads in battleground states.

title: State of the Race: A Close Race Gets Closer
content: There’s no sign that a deluge of surveys from Republican-aligned firms is meaningfully affecting the polling averages.

title: Where Polls Can Mess Up (and What Pollsters Do About It)
content: Conducting a poll isn’t an exact science. The process is susceptible to lots of common problems and baked-in biases — more than just the “margin of error.”

title: NASA Launches Europa Clipper to Explore an Ocean Moon’s Habitability
content: The spacecraft lifted off Monday on a SpaceX Falcon Heavy rocket, embarking on a nearly six-year journey to Jupiter.

title: Can Charlotte, N.C., Deliver for Kamala Harris?
content: Mecklenburg County leans liberal but has broken Democrats’ hearts in past elections with low voter turnout. A new party leader wants to change that.

title: The Trump Voters Who Don’t Believe Trump
content: When the former president endorses violence and proposes using the government to attack his enemies, many of his supporters assume it’s just an act.

title: Three Weeks to Go, and That’s All Anyone Is Sure Of
content: It’s been a long year. That won’t stop it from being a very long 22 days.

title: Russian Oil Flows Through Western ‘Price Cap’ as Shadow Fleet Grows
content: A report shows how Russia has largely evaded sanctions aimed at limiting its revenue from oil sales.

title: In a Tight Presidential Race, Third-Party Candidates Present a Wild Card
content: In every battleground state this year, there is at least one third-party or independent candidate on the ballot. The Democrats have been more openly concerned than Republicans.

title: How Wall St. Is Subtly Shaping the Harris Economic Agenda
content: The vice president has repeatedly incorporated suggestions from business executives into her economic agenda.

title: Food Is What We Have In Common. Why Don’t We Hear More From the Candidates About It?
content: Food is the springboard to talk about a host of issues, including climate, economic justice, public health and labor.

title: In Rural Wisconsin, Race Is an Undercurrent of the Presidential Election
content: Former President Donald Trump’s recent attacks on his opponent could affect the vote. “It’s a stirring of the pot,” one voter said.

title: A Fact Checker Reflects on Our Age of Political Lying
content: In “Beyond the Big Lie,” Bill Adair worries that the world of spin and fabrication in America has gotten out of hand.

title: Kash Patel: The Magical Rise of a Self-Described ‘Wizard’ in Trump World
content: The MAGA loyalist Mr. Patel aims to run the C.I.A. if Donald Trump wins the presidency. But critics say his swagger masks deep inexperience.

title: In Heated House Race, a Moderate Republican Goes Full Trump
content: Representative Marc Molinaro of New York, running against Josh Riley, a Democrat, has accused recent immigrants of committing violent crimes and killing pets.

title: What China’s Leaders Grasp About Another Trump Term
content: Trump remains well outside a bipartisan consensus on competing with China.

title: Trump Receives Endorsement from Border Patrol Union
content: The National Border Patrol Council formally pledged its support for the former president, appearing onstage with him during a rally in Arizona.

title: Harris Rallies in North Carolina
content: The vice president criticized former President Donald J. Trump, calling him “weak and unstable.”

title: Man Is Arrested on Weapons Charges Heading to Trump Rally in Coachella, Officials Say
content: Law-enforcement officials said that former President Donald J. Trump was not in any danger, and the man was released on bail.

title: Harris Suggests Trump Is ‘Weak and Unstable’ in Pointed Challenge
content: Kamala Harris asked why Donald J. Trump had not released his medical records, appeared on “60 Minutes” or agreed to a second debate.

title: Harris Sends a Secret Weapon to a Georgia Fish Fry: Bill Clinton
content: With early voting set to begin in Georgia, the Harris campaign is sending the former president to get out the vote in rural areas.
